schema.title: Response Get Notifications Settings Api Accounts Preferences Notifications Get
Response Update Notifications Settings Api Accounts Preferences Notifications Patch

get.description:
Fetch the current authenticated user's profile for client display.

This endpoint returns basic profile information for the logged-in user.

Returns
-------
UserResponse
    The authenticated user's profile information.

patch.description:
Update fields in the current user's profile.

Accepts partial updates and returns the latest version of the profile.

Returns
-------
UserResponse
    The updated user profile.

delete.description:
Perform a hard delete on the currently logged-in user's account.

Returns
-------
None
    Returns HTTP 204 No Content on success.

post.description:
Validate email activation link (signup token) after user clicks the verification email.

This endpoint is triggered by the frontend when a user clicks the activation link from their email.
It verifies the token's integrity, expiration, and the user's activation status.
If valid, it allows the frontend to proceed to the profile completion form.
Check if the given email already exists in the system.

Sends a password reset link to the provided email address.

If the email exists, a reset link will be sent asynchronously.
Always returns 204 to prevent exposing user existence.

Returns
-------
204 No Content

get.description:
Redirects the user to the Google OAuth login page for sign-in.

This endpoint generates a URL that directs the user to Google's OAuth 2.0
authorization page, initiating the sign-in flow.

Returns
-------
dict
    A dictionary containing the redirect URL under the key "redirect_url".

This endpoint receives the authorization code from Google, exchanges it for
an access token, fetches the user's Google profile, and generates an internal
access token (JWT) if the user exists in the system.

Parameters
----------
code : str
    The authorization code returned by Google OAuth.
db : AsyncSession
    SQLAlchemy async database session (injected by FastAPI).

Returns
-------
RedirectResponse
    Redirects the user to the frontend login page with a JWT token in the query string,
    or with "token=null" if the user does not exist.

Redirects the user to the Google OAuth login page for sign-up.

This endpoint generates a URL that directs the user to Google's OAuth 2.0
authorization page, initiating the sign-up flow.

Returns
-------
dict
    A dictionary containing the redirect URL under the key "redirect_url".

This endpoint redirects the user
to the frontend account creation page.

Returns
-------
RedirectResponse
    Redirects the user to the frontend account creation page.

Retrieve Google user profile using authorization code.

This endpoint exchanges the provided authorization code for an access token,
retrieves the user's profile information from Google, and returns it in JSON format.

Parameters
----------
code : str
    The authorization code obtained from Google OAuth.

Returns
-------
JSONResponse
    User information containing email, first name, and last name.

post.description: Authenticate a user and return a JWT access token if credentials are valid.
Register a new user and return a JWT signup token.
Reset user password using a valid token.

Validates and logs in a user using a previously issued JWT access token.

This endpoint decodes and validates a JWT access token (e.g., from Google or internal issuance),
retrieves the corresponding user from the database, and returns a new bearer token if the user exists.

Parameters
----------
token : HTTPAuthorizationCredentials
    The bearer token extracted from the Authorization header (e.g., "Bearer <token>").
db : AsyncSession
    The database session dependency.

Raises
------
HTTPException
    400 - If the request body contains unexpected fields.
    401 - If the token is invalid, expired, or improperly signed.
    404 - If no user is found for the decoded user ID.

patch.description: Update password for the currently authenticated user.

parameters.name: job_status

schema.description: Filter training jobs by job status
schema.title: Job Status

parameters.description: Filter training jobs by job status

post.description:
Create a new training job under a specific project.  
This endpoint performs the following validations before creating the job:

1. **Duplicate Name Check**  
   - Ensures no other training job with the same name exists in the project.

2. **Project Type Validation**  
   - Confirms that the `task` field in `aasconfig.globals.task` matches the type of the specified project.
   - Allowed types include: anomaly, classification, segmentation, object_detection, and oriented_object_detection.

3. **Augmentation Pipeline Validation**  
   - Validates both `train_dataset` and `val_dataset` augmentation pipelines.
   - Each pipeline must:
     - End with `Normalize` and `ToTensorV2`
     - Include `Resize` or `LongestMaxSize`, with width/height or size >= 64
     - Only contains augmentations from whitelist: Affine,RandomGamma,LongestMaxSize,PadSquare,ToTensorV2,Normalize,ColorJitter,Resize,HorizontalFlip

4. **Image Split Validation**  
   - Ensures `train` and `val` splits meet minimum image counts:
     - For anomaly tasks: project must have at least one annotation labeled as "OK"
     - For all other tasks: train ≥ 2 image, val ≥ 1 image

5. **Batch Size Adjustment**
   - If there are fewer images in training set than batch size, set batch size to the number of training images.

6. **Job Creation**
   - The validated job is inserted into the database with status `standby`.
   - Finally, the job is dispatched to a worker queue for asynchronous processing.

BackendCfg.title: BackendCfg
BackendCfg.description:
Examples
--------

1. Python

>>> BackendCfg(
...    backend="AASDataHubBackend",
...    backend_kwargs={"dataset_name": "dataset-name-on-datacenter", "task": "classification"},
... )
backend='AASDataHubBackend' backend_kwargs={'dataset_name': 'dataset-name-on-datacenter', 'task': 'classification'}
>>> BackendCfg(
...    backend="AASDataHubBackend",
...    backend_kwargs={"dataset_name": "path/to/local/dataset", "task": "segmentation"},
... )
backend='AASDataHubBackend' backend_kwargs={'dataset_name': 'path/to/local/dataset', 'task': 'segmentation'}
>>> BackendCfg(
...    backend="AASCSVBackend",
...    backend_kwargs={
...        "root_dir": "path/to/dataset_root",
...        "csv_path": "path/to/csv_file.csv",
...        "bbox_type": BboxType.XY_CENTER_WH,
...    },
...)
backend='AASCSVBackend' backend_kwargs={'root_dir': 'path/to/dataset_root', 'csv_path': 'path/to/csv_file.csv',
'bbox_type': <BboxType.XY_CENTER_WH: 0>}


2. YAML

.. code-block:: yaml
    :caption: train_dataset uses AASDataHubBackend

    train_dataset:
        backends:
            backend: AASDataHubBackend
            backend_kwargs:
                dataset_name: dataset-name-on-datacenter
                task: classification

.. code-block:: yaml
    :caption: train_dataset uses AASDataHubBackend in local path

    train_dataset:
        backend: AASDataHubBackend
            backend_kwargs:
              dataset_name: path/to/local/dataset
              task: segmentation

.. code-block:: yaml
    :caption: val_dataset uses AASCSVBackend

    val_dataset:
        backends:
            backend: AASCSVBackend
            backend_kwargs:
                csv_path: path/to/csv_file.csv
                root_dir: path/to/dataset_root

See Also
--------
aascore.data.dataset.AASDataset: AASCore dataset
aascore.data.storage.AASDataHubBackend: AASDataHub backend
aascore.data.storage.AASCSVBackend: AAS CSV backend

Notification.title: Notification
Notification.description:
Represents a notification sent to a user.

This table stores system and user-generated notifications. Each notification
is associated with a specific user (`user_id`) and contains a message (`message`).

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier of the notification.

type.description: The type of the notification (e.g., INFO, WARNING, ERROR).

event_name.title: Event Name
event_name.description: The name of the event that triggered the notification.

message.title: Message
message.description: The message content of the notification.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The timestamp when the notification was created.

read_at.title: Read At
read_at.description: The timestamp when the notification was read, if applicable.

page_info.description: The routing information used to navigate to the relevant page.

image_ids.title: Image Ids
image_ids.description: List of image IDs to associate with the project.

dataset_id.title: Dataset Id
dataset_id.description: The updated dataset associated with the project, if provided.

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier of the project.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of the project.

workspace_id.title: Workspace Id
workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace associated with the project.

image_count.title: Image Count
image_count.description: The number of images associated with the project.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The timestamp when the project was created.

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: The timestamp when the project was last updated.

deleted_at.title: Deleted At
deleted_at.description: The timestamp when the project was deleted, if applicable.

dataset_id.title: Dataset Id
dataset_id.description: The dataset associated with the project.

task_count.title: Task Count
task_count.description: The number of tasks related to the project.

owned_by.title: Owned By
owned_by.description: The user ID of the project owner.

current.title: Current
current.description: The current usage amount of the specified resource.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: The maximum allowed quota for the specified resource.

recovery_codes.title: Recovery Codes
recovery_codes.description: One-time recovery codes. Save them securely

industry.description: Industry the user is associated with

referral_person.title: Referral Person
referral_person.description: Name of the person who referred the user

usage_type.description: Whether the user is using the platform for personal or business purposes

agree_privacy.title: Agree Privacy
agree_privacy.description: Indicates whether the user agrees to the privacy policy and authorizes the use of provided information for account registration and service delivery.

agree_license.title: Agree License
agree_license.description: Indicates whether the user agrees to the End User License Agreement (EULA).

agree_edm.title: Agree Edm
agree_edm.description: Indicates whether the user agrees to receive news, promotions, product updates, and service information via email or other communication channels.

created_by.title: Created By
created_by.description: The user who creates this notification.

workspace_name.title: Workspace Name
workspace_name.description: Optional workspace name, auto-filled if not provided

project_name.title: Project Name
project_name.description: Name of the project under which the task is executed.

task_name.title: Task Name
task_name.description: Descriptive name or identifier of the task.

failed_reason.title: Failed Reason
failed_reason.description: Detailed reason for task failure, if applicable. Leave blank if the task did not fail.

num_nodes.title: Num Nodes
num_nodes.description: Number of GPU nodes for distributed training.

fast_dev_run.title: Fast Dev Run
fast_dev_run.description: Runs n if set to ``n`` (int) else 1 if set to ``True`` batch(es) of train, val and test to find any bugs (ie: a sort of unit test). Default: ``False``.

max_time.title: Max Time
max_time.description: Stop the training after this amount of time has passed. Defaults to `None`.The time duration can be specified in the format DD:HH:MM:SS (days, hours, minutes seconds), or a dictionary with keys `days`, `hours`, `minutes` and `seconds`.

limit_train_batches.title: Limit Train Batches
limit_train_batches.description: How much of training dataset to check. (float = fraction, int = num_batches).

limit_val_batches.title: Limit Val Batches
limit_val_batches.description: How much of validation dataset to check. (float = fraction, int = num_batches).

limit_test_batches.title: Limit Test Batches
limit_test_batches.description: How much of test dataset to check. (float = fraction, int = num_batches).

limit_predict_batches.title: Limit Predict Batches
limit_predict_batches.description: How much of predict dataset to check. (float = fraction, int = num_batches).

overfit_batches.title: Overfit Batches
overfit_batches.description: Overfit a fraction of training/validation data (float) or a set number of batches (int).

val_check_interval.title: Val Check Interval
val_check_interval.description: How often to check the validation set.

num_sanity_val_steps.title: Num Sanity Val Steps
num_sanity_val_steps.description: Sanity check runs n validation batches before starting the training routine. Set it to -1 to run all batches in all validation dataloaders. Default: 2.

log_every_n_steps.title: Log Every N Steps
log_every_n_steps.description: How often to log within steps.

enable_model_summary.title: Enable Model Summary
enable_model_summary.description: Whether to enable model summarization by default. Default: True.

accumulate_grad_batches.title: Accumulate Grad Batches
accumulate_grad_batches.description: Accumulates grads every k batches or as set up in the dict. Default: 1.

gradient_clip_val.title: Gradient Clip Val
gradient_clip_val.description: The value at which to clip the gradients. Passing `None` disables gradient clipping. Default: None.

gradient_clip_algorithm.title: Gradient Clip Algorithm
gradient_clip_algorithm.description: The algorithm to use for gradient clipping. Either pass `value` apply `clip by value`, or pass `norm` to apply `clip by norm`. Default: None.

deterministic.title: Deterministic
deterministic.description: Sets whether PyTorch operations must use deterministic algorithms.

benchmark.title: Benchmark
benchmark.description: If true enables cudnn.benchmark. Default: None.

inference_mode.title: Inference Mode
inference_mode.description: Whether to use `torch.inference_mode` or `torch.no_grad` during evaluation.

use_distributed_sampler.title: Use Distributed Sampler
use_distributed_sampler.description: Whether to wrap the DataLoader's sampler with `torch.utils.data.DistributedSampler` if needed.

profiler.title: Profiler
profiler.description: To profile individual steps during training and assist in identifying bottlenecks.

detect_anomaly.title: Detect Anomaly
detect_anomaly.description: Enable anomaly detection for the autograd engine.

sync_batchnorm.title: Sync Batchnorm
sync_batchnorm.description: Enable synchronized batch normalization between process groups / whole world.

reload_dataloaders_every_n_epochs.title: Reload Dataloaders Every N Epochs
reload_dataloaders_every_n_epochs.description: Set to a positive integer to reload dataloaders every n epochs.

default_root_dir.title: Default Root Dir
default_root_dir.description: Default path for logs and weights when no logger/ckpt_callback passed. Default: ``os.getcwd()``.

TrainCfg.title: TrainCfg
TrainCfg.description:
The configuration for training the model.

Note
----
1. The order of fields in this class should align with the order of argument in the `Lightning.Trainer`.
2. All the fields could be found in the `Lightning.Trainer` class, except for the `seed` field, which is
     used to set the random seed for reproducibility.

TrainingJob.title: TrainingJob
TrainingJob.description:
Represents a training job in the system.

A training job is associated with a project.

total_count.title: Total Count
total_count.description: The total number of training jobs.

jobs.title: Jobs
jobs.description: A list of training job responses.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the training job.

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: The unique identifier of the associated project.

aasconfig.description: The configuration settings for the AAS process.

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier of the training job.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the training job.

status.description: The current status of the training job.

project_name.title: Project Name
project_name.description: The name of the project associated with the training job.

project_type.description: The type of the project associated with the training job.

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: The unique identifier of the associated project.

started_at.title: Started At
started_at.description: The start time of the training job, if available.

finished_at.title: Finished At
finished_at.description: The finish time of the training job, if available.

current_progress.title: Current Progress
current_progress.description: The current progress of the training job.

total_count.title: Total Count
total_count.description: The total number of the user.

onsite.title: Onsite
onsite.description: Enable or disable on-site notifications. Default is True.

email.title: Email
email.description: Enable or disable email notifications. Default is False.

browser.title: Browser
browser.description: Enable or disable browser push notifications. Default is False.

industry.description: Industry the user is associated with

referral_person.title: Referral Person
referral_person.description: Name of the person who referred the user

industry.title: Industry
industry.description: Industry the user is associated with

referral_person.title: Referral Person
referral_person.description: Name of the person who referred the user

usage_type.title: Usage Type
usage_type.description: Whether the user is using the platform for personal or business purposes

activated_at.title: Activated At
activated_at.description: Timestamp when the user completed activation. Null if not activated yet.

mfa_enabled.title: Mfa Enabled
mfa_enabled.description: Whether MFA is enabled for the user

role.description: Workspace role to assign to the users

current_usage.title: Current Usage
current_usage.description: The current storage usage in GB.

Workspace.title: Workspace
Workspace.description:
Represents a workspace in the system.

A workspace is a container for collaborative projects, owned by a specific user.
It maintains metadata such as ownership, creation time, update time, and soft deletion.

total_available.title: Total Available
total_available.description: The total available storage in GB for the workspace.

current_usage.title: Current Usage
current_usage.description: The current storage usage in GB for the workspace.

total_count.title: Total Count
total_count.description: The total number of the workspace member.

pending.title: Pending
pending.description: True if the user has not joined the workspace yet (invited).

is_owner.title: Is Owner
is_owner.description: True if the user is the owner of the workspace.

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier of the workspace.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of the workspace.

subscription_name.title: Subscription Name
subscription_name.description: The subscription plan name associated with the workspace.
